records.text: Camus discusses Spartacus's rebellion which shares curious similarities with #pregozhin march on Moscow.Not to ascribe and grandeur to his 'uprising', but it does show that to be able to successfully  go from rebellion to revolution, one must bear the entire burden of the previous ruler.Perhaps this is why revolution often amounts to totalitarian rule when challenging the present order in general.

records.text: I'd love for an with AI to come help me deal with my autistic son, who screams everytime I *don't* act like a machine when I forget something. Make a robot that can change diapers or dry him off for the 10th time in a day. Please automate making the same three sandwiches for breakfast and lunch each day. Please make it a kind, reaffirming entity everytime that doesn't become angry or frustrated with his nature.And that way I can spend time drawing, making D&D adventures and writing code.
